# Check for new, updated or deleted data
- This script checks for new, updated or deleted data by checking the source data (sap hr) against the target (odw_harmonised_db.Employee_HR_Hierarchy_Dim)
- **New Data:** where an EmployeeID in the source does not exist as an EmployeeID in the target. NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Updated data:** Comparison occurs on EmployeeID in source and EmployeeID in target where the row hash is different i.e. there is a change in one of the columns. NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Deleted data:** where an EmployeeID in the target exists but the same EmployeeID doesn't exist in the source. DeletedData flag is set to 'Y'

## View employee_hr_hierarchy_dim_new is created

%%sql
-- Build employee_hr_hierarchy_dim table
-- Gets modified or deleted from source rows

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW employee_hr_hierarchy_dim_new
    AS

-- gets data that matches of SourceID and flags that it is modified based on a row (md5) hash. Flags as "NewData"
-- gets data that is in the target but not in source. Flags as "DeletedData"

SELECT DISTINCT
    CASE
        WHEN T1.Pers_No IS NULL
        THEN T7.EmployeeHRHierarchyID
        ELSE NULL
    END as EmployeeHRHierarchyID, -- surrogate key
    T1.Pers_No AS EmployeeID,
    T1.Pers_No_1 as ManagerEmployeeID,
    T2.SourceSystemID as SourceSystemID,
    to_timestamp(T1.expected_from) AS IngestionDate,
    NULL AS ValidTo,
    md5(concat(IFNULL(T1.Pers_No,'.'), IFNULL(T1.Pers_No_1,'.'))) as RowID,
    'Y' as IsActive,
    T7.IsActive as HistoricIsActive

FROM odw_standardised_db.vw_saphr T1
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.main_sourcesystem_fact T2 ON "SAP HR" = T2.Description
FULL JOIN odw_harmonised_db.hr_employee_hr_hierarchy_dim T7 ON T1.Pers_No = T7.EmployeeID AND T7.IsActive = 'Y'
WHERE 
--  flags new data        
        (   CASE
                WHEN T1.Pers_No = T7.EmployeeID AND md5(concat(IFNULL(T1.Pers_No,'.'), IFNULL(T1.Pers_No_1,'.'))) <> T7.RowID    -- same employee, changed data
                THEN 'Y'
                WHEN T7.EmployeeID IS NULL -- new employee
                THEN 'Y'
                ELSE 'N'
            END = 'Y' )
AND T1.Pers_No IS NOT NULL

# Dataset is created that contains changed data and corresponding target data
- This script combines data that has been updated, Deleted or is new, with corresponding target data
- View **employee_hr_hierarchy_dim_new** is unioned to the target data filter to only those rows where changes have been detected
## View employee_hr_hierarchy_dim_changed_rows is created

%%sql
-- Create new and updated dataset

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW employee_hr_hierarchy_dim_changed_rows

    AS

-- gets updated, deleted and new rows 

Select 
    EmployeeHRHierarchyID, -- surrogate key
    EmployeeID,
    ManagerEmployeeID,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
    
From employee_hr_hierarchy_dim_new WHERE HistoricIsActive = 'Y' or HistoricIsActive IS NULL

    UNION ALL

-- gets original versions of updated rows so we can update EndDate and set IsActive flag to 'N'

SELECT
    EmployeeHRHierarchyID, -- surrogate key
    EmployeeID,
    ManagerEmployeeID,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM odw_harmonised_db.hr_employee_hr_hierarchy_dim
WHERE EmployeeID IN (SELECT EmployeeID FROM employee_hr_hierarchy_dim_new WHERE EmployeeHRHierarchyID IS NULL) 
AND IsActive = 'Y';

%%sql

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW Loading_month

    AS

SELECT DISTINCT
    IngestionDate AS IngestionDate,
    to_timestamp(date_sub(IngestionDate,1)) AS ClosingDate,
    'Y' AS IsActive

FROM employee_hr_hierarchy_dim_new;

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW employee_hr_hierarchy_dim_changed_rows_final

    AS

SELECT 
    T1.EmployeeHRHierarchyID,
    T1.EmployeeID,
    T1.ManagerEmployeeID,
    T1.SourceSystemID,
    T1.IngestionDate,
    T1.ValidTo,
    T1.RowID,
    T1.IsActive,
    T2.ClosingDate
FROM employee_hr_hierarchy_dim_changed_rows T1
FULL JOIN Loading_month T2 ON T1.IsActive = T2.IsActive

# View employee_hr_hierarchy_dim_changed_rows is used in a merge (Upsert) statement into the target table
- **WHEN MATCHED** ON the Business Key (i.e. EmployeeID from employee_dim), EndDate is set to today -1 day and the IsActive flag is set to 'N'
- **WHEN NOT MATCHED** ON the business key, insert rows
## Table odw_harmonised_db.employee_hr_hierarchy_dim is updated

%%sql

-- merge into dim table

MERGE INTO odw_harmonised_db.hr_employee_hr_hierarchy_dim AS Target
USING employee_hr_hierarchy_dim_changed_rows_final AS Source

ON Source.EmployeeHRHierarchyID = Target.EmployeeHRHierarchyID

-- For Updates existing rows

WHEN MATCHED
    THEN 
    UPDATE SET
    Target.ValidTo = to_timestamp(ClosingDate),
    Target.IsActive = 'N'
        
-- Insert completely new rows
WHEN NOT MATCHED 
    THEN INSERT (EmployeeHRHierarchyID, 
        EmployeeID,
        ManagerEmployeeID,
        SourceSystemID,
        IngestionDate,
        ValidTo,
        RowID,
        IsActive)  
        VALUES (Source.EmployeeHRHierarchyID, 
        Source.EmployeeID,
        Source.ManagerEmployeeID,
        Source.SourceSystemID, 
        Source.IngestionDate, 
        Source.ValidTo, 
        Source.RowID, 
        Source.IsActive) ;

# Fix the IDs
- No auto-increment feature is available in delta tables, therefore we need to create new IDs for the inserted rows
- This is done by select the target data and using INSERT OVERWRITE to re-insert the data is a new Row Number
## Table odw_harmonised_db.employee_hr_hierarchy_dim is updated

%%sql
-- Insert new employee_hr_hierarchy_dim

INSERT OVERWRITE odw_harmonised_db.hr_employee_hr_hierarchy_dim

SELECT 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY EmployeeHRHierarchyID NULLS LAST) AS EmployeeHRHierarchyID,
    EmployeeID,
    ManagerEmployeeID,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM odw_harmonised_db.hr_employee_hr_hierarchy_dim;
